authors: Bryant Hevesi For Daily Mail Australia
description: Cameras have captured the romantic moment a Brisbane woman's fiance proposed to her after riding a horse to her work while wearing a knight's armour.
title: Brisbane man proposes wearing custom made knight's uniform
title_page: Brisbane man proposes wearing custom made knight's uniform | Daily Mail Online
text:
This is the romantic moment a woman began her own 'fairy tale.'
The unsuspecting Brisbane woman was sitting with a group of workmates this week when she was told someone was waiting for her outside.
The woman's soon-to-be husband rode a horse to the woman's office building, clad in his own custom made knight's uniform.
Scroll down for video
A Brisbane man has proposed to his partner while dressed as a knight in shining armour
The man knew how to make an entrance - he had approached his partner's workplace while riding a horse
He walked towards his fiancee, who was captured on camera visibly excited by the shinning light before her eyes.
The man took off his helmet to reveal himself and delivered a 'Hello baby!'
'Our romance has been nothing but a fairy tale,' he said.
'And I thought I'd like to make it one.'
He then got down on my knee and, giggling uncontrollably as he almost tipped over from the weight of the armour, asked his partner 'could you please marry me', to which she replied 'I would love to'.
The couple then embraced while rose petals were thrown over them by the woman's workmates.
